subject: Re: [junit] How to test without returning any return value.
msgSnippet: ... Absolutely. The mock objects approach is based on what Michael describes here: passing in a spy object that the method under test operates on, then
messageBody:
Michael Feathers wrote:
>
> W> you should create small pieces of code which returns some value and after
> W> that you create a bigger code calling the smalls.
>
> Another way is to create small pieces of code and test their effects
> on other objects rather than returning values.
>
> These are just two different ways of approaching design problems.

Absolutely. The mock objects approach is based on what Michael describes
here: passing in a "spy" object that the method under test operates on,
then looking at the spy afterward to verify that it was used correctly.
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
